greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numbers having three 1's in their base-phi representation.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Phi Number System
formula: a(n) = Lucas(2*n-4) + 1, for n>3. - _Ralf Stephan_, Nov 13 2010
program: (PARI) for(n=1,50, print1(if(n==1,4, if(n==2, 5, if(n==3, 6, 1 + fibonacci(2*n-3) + fibonacci(2*n-5)))), ", ")) \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Aug 13 2018
(MAGMA) [4,5,6] cat [1 + Fibonacci(2*n-3) + Fibonacci(2*n-5): n in [4..50]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Aug 13 2018
results.author: _Eric W. Weisstein_, Mar 17 2005
ext: Terms 5 and 6 added by _Jaroslav Krizek_, May 25 2010
